definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: I think my brother has finally kicked the gambling habit.
sentences.chinese: 我想我哥哥算是絕對改掉牌賭的惡習啦。

sentences.english: If only I could get out of my timidness, I would feel better.
sentences.chinese: 只要我改掉自己膽怯的缺點，我就能感覺好點。

sentences.english: It was easier just to leave the relationship than to leave my bulimic lifestyle of 25 years.
sentences.chinese: 結束一段關係比改掉我25年的暴食症要容易得多。

sentences.english: She had always said how lucky she was to have been able to lose her Lincolnshire accent.
sentences.chinese: 她常常談到爲能改掉林肯郡口音感到高興。

sentences.english: You really should break the habit of reading your horoscope every day, before it's too late.
sentences.chinese: 你得改掉這個每天都算命的習慣，亡羊補牢爲時未晚。

sentences.english: while refining her coarse street accent and teaching her discipline.
sentences.chinese: 他還幫助她改掉街頭粗鄙的口音，教會她懂得規矩。

sentences.english: From then on, the king of Qi gave up his bad habit of drinking and playing all night.
sentences.chinese: 從那以後，齊威王改掉了整晚飲酒作樂的壞習慣。

sentences.english: She coaxed him out of his bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 她循循善誘地勸他改掉壞脾氣。

sentences.english: When you are aware, you can change it.
sentences.chinese: 當你意識到了，你就能改掉它。
現在類似的神權政體甚至很難改掉。

sentences.english: I am certain both of them would love to quit for this new year.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定他們兩人都想在這新的一年裏改掉抽菸的習慣。

sentences.english: You have yourself a little TV addict, so now let's break that habit.
sentences.chinese: 你自己也有點電視迷，所以現在改掉那個習慣吧。

sentences.english: The mother wanted her little son to get rid of the bad habit of picking at his food.
sentences.chinese: 母親要她的小兒子改掉喫飯時喫喫玩玩的壞習慣。

sentences.english: No punctuality is a bad habit. We should get rid of it.
sentences.chinese: 不守時是壞習慣，我們應改掉它。

sentences.english: If that person has some bad part which I also have. I will correct it.
sentences.chinese: 如果這個人有不好的地方而我也有，那我就將改掉。

definition: to cultivate/to raise/to form (a habit)/to acquire
habit/custom/usual practice/to be used to/CL:個|个[ge4]
to correct/to amend/to put right/correction/CL:個|个[ge4]
to quit/to give up (a bad habit)
habit becomes nature (idiom); get used to something and it seems inevitable/second nature
It is hard to change one's essential nature (idiom). You can't change who you are./Can the leopard change his spots? (Jeremiah 13:23)
early to bed, early to rise/to keep early hours
